result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: contrast experiments were conducted (Table 1, entry 8-10), including (i) blank experiments in the absence of a catalyst; (ii) experiments performed using TiO 2 NSs11.5TCPPas a catalyst under dark conditions; (iii) irradiation of the TiO 2 NSs11.5TCPPwith visible light in an argon atmosphere instead of CO 2 .No reaction product of CO and CH 4 were detected in all the contrast experiments.If the TiO 2 NSs11.5 TCPP was removed from the reaction system, the CO 2 reduction reaction was terminated.No evolution

under the same experimental conditions.The reduction products of CO and CH 4 were identified by gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS), as shown in Fig. 4d.The peaks in the GC spectrum with mz 29 and m z 17 were assigned to 13 CO and 13 CH 4 , respectively.The results provide evidence that the carbon source of 13 CO and 13 CH 4 completely stemmed from the reductive 13 CO 2 .To definitively prove the role of the TiO 2 NSsTCPP catalysts in the photocatalytic system, several contrast experiments were

onto a silica filter membrane (diameter, 47 mm) under suction filtration conditions.Then the filter membrane loaded with TiO 2 NSsTCPP catalyst was dried at 80 C for 12 h in air. The photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 was evaluated in gas-closed circulation system (Perfect Light Company, Beijing, China) using a glass reactor.The reactor was made of borosilicate glass with an optical quartz window (diameter, 9 cm; thickness, 8 mm) at the top.The scheme and photo of the glass reactor is shown in Fig. S2.The

was terminated.No evolution of CO and CH 4 was detected in the dark, indicating this reaction is truly light-driven photocatalytic reaction.These results demonstrate that TiO 2 NSsTCPP plays a crucial role for harnessing light to drive the reaction.When using high purity Ar to replace CO 2 to perform the reaction under identical conditions, no evolution of CO and CH 4 can be detected, confirming the carbon atoms of CO and CH 4 are not derived from inorganic or organic residues adsorbed on the surface of

a MeCN solvent with TEOA as the sacrificial electron donor.The CO 2 photoreduction experiment was initially performed using either pure TiO 2 NSs or TCPP as catalysts.Under these conditions, TCPP shows almost no activity, while the TiO 2 NSs only shows poor activity on the photoreduction of CO 2 to CO (3.72 mol g -1 h -1 ).Compared to pure TiO 2 NSs and TCPP, all the TiO 2 NSsTCPP with different TCPP loadings show significantly improved performance.After irradiation under visible light for 12 h,

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX
